verses.text: 這月二十四日，以色列人聚集，一同禁食，身穿麻衣，頭上蒙灰。

words.note: Coarse clothing worn as a sign of mourning or repentance.
Covering one's head with ashes was a sign of repentance and sorrow.

verses.text: 以色列的後裔跟所有外族人分離，然後站立，承認自己的罪過和他們列祖的罪孽。
那天四分之一的時間，他們站在自己的地方，宣讀耶和華他們的 神的律法書；另外四分之一的時間，他們認罪和敬拜耶和華他們的 神。

words.note: Capitalized when referring to the one true God.
Capitalized when referring to the one true God.

verses.text: 耶書亞、巴尼、甲篾、示巴尼、布尼、示利比、巴尼和基拿尼，站立在利未人的臺階上，向耶和華他們的 神大聲哀求。

words.note: Capitalized when referring to the one true God.

verses.text: 利未人耶書亞、甲篾、巴尼、哈沙尼、示利比、荷第雅、示巴尼和毗他希雅說：「你們要起立，稱頌耶和華你們的 神，直到永永遠遠。」「耶和華啊，你榮耀的名是應當稱頌的；願你的名被尊崇，超過一切稱頌和讚美。

words.note: Capitalized when referring to the one true God.
Repetition emphasizes eternity, often used in religious texts.

verses.text: 你，唯獨你是耶和華，你造了天，天上的天和天軍，地和地上的萬物，海和海中的萬物，你使這一切生存，天軍也都敬拜你。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
天上的天 (heavens of heavens) refers to the highest heavens.
Refers to angels or celestial beings.
Refers to angels or celestial beings.

verses.text: 你是耶和華 神，你揀選亞伯蘭，帶領他出了迦勒底的吾珥，改他的名字為亞伯拉罕。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Often capitalized in Christian contexts.
Original name of Abraham, meaning 'exalted father'.
Ancient Mesopotamian city, Abram's birthplace.
Meaning 'father of a multitude'.

verses.text: 你見他在你面前心裡誠實可靠，就與他立約，要把迦南人、赫人、亞摩利人、比利洗人、耶布斯人和革迦撒人之地，賜給他的後裔；你履行了你的諾言，因為你是公義的。

words.note: More formal than 和/跟.
Literary/classical equivalent of 的.

verses.text: 你看見我們的列祖在埃及所受的困苦，垂聽他們在紅海的哀求，

words.note: Indicates the following verb phrase is a passive experience or the object of a verb.
Implies a higher authority listening to a humble plea.

verses.text: 因為你知道埃及人怎樣狂妄自大地對待他們，所以就對法老和他的一切臣僕，以及他國中所有的人民，施行神蹟奇事，為你自己建立了至今仍存的名聲。

words.note: Connects an adjective or phrase to a verb, indicating manner.
Title for ancient Egyptian rulers.
Forms a nominal phrase with the following verb.

verses.text: 你又在我們的列祖面前把海分開，使他們在海中的乾地上走過去；把追趕他們的人丟在深處，好像石頭拋進怒海之中。

words.note: A more poetic or literary term for a furious sea.

verses.text: 日間你用雲柱引導他們，夜間用火柱光照他們要行的路。

words.note: Refers to the pillar of cloud that guided Israel in the wilderness.
Refers to the pillar of fire that guided Israel at night.
More formal than everyday expressions for 'to light up'.

verses.text: 你降臨西奈山上，從天上與他們說話，賜給他們正直的典章、真實的律法、美好的條例與誡命。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for divine appearance.
Contextually refers to the divine realm.
More formal and respectful than 'to give'.
Refers to formal rules or decrees, often divine.
Refers specifically to God's law or commandments.
Formal rules or provisions.
Specifically refers to divine commands.

verses.text: 你使他們認識你的聖安息，藉你僕人摩西向他們頒布誡命、條例和律法。

words.note: Refers to the Sabbath day, a day of holy rest.
More formal than '通過' (tōngguò).
Formal term for officially announcing or enacting.
Specifically refers to divine commands.
Formal rules or provisions.
Refers specifically to God's law or commandments.

verses.text: 你從天上賜下糧食，給他們充飢，吩咐水從磐石流出來給他們解渴；你又吩咐他們進去佔領，你舉手起誓要賜給他們的那地。

words.note: Contextually refers to the divine realm.
Often used for divine provision or blessing.
More formal expression for 'to fill one's stomach'.
Often used for commands given by a superior.
Often used in the Bible, e.g., the rock from which Moses drew water.
Often used for commands given by a superior.
More formal or archaic than everyday swearing.
More formal and respectful than 'to give'.

verses.text: 但是我們的列祖狂妄自大，硬著頸項，不聽從你的命令。

words.note: An idiom (chengyu) describing extreme arrogance.
Often used metaphorically as 'stiff-necked' for stubbornness.

verses.text: 他們拒絕聽從，也不記念你在他們中間所行的奇事，硬著頸項，存心悖逆，自立首領，要回到他們為奴之地去。但你是樂意饒恕的 神，你有恩典，有憐憫，不輕易發怒，並有豐盛的慈愛，所以你沒有撇棄他們。

words.note: Indicates the object of the verb or what is performed.
Often used metaphorically as 'stiff-necked' for stubbornness.
Lit. 'to hold in one's heart'.
The space indicates reverence for 'God'.

verses.text: 他們更為自己鑄造了一頭牛犢的雕像，說：『這就是把你們從埃及領上來的神！』他們犯了褻瀆大罪，

words.note: Indicates that the object follows the verb.
Here referring to a false god (the idol).

verses.text: 你還是因著你豐盛的憐憫，沒有把他們撇棄在曠野；日間雲柱沒有離開他們，仍然在路上引導他們；夜間火柱也沒有離開他們，還是光照他們要行的路。

words.note: Indicates that the object follows the verb.

words.definition: on the road, along the way

verses.text: 你賜下良善的靈教導他們；你沒有留住嗎哪不給他們吃；你給他們水解渴。

words.note: The miraculous food provided to the Israelites.

verses.text: 在曠野四十年，你供養他們，他們毫無缺乏，衣服沒有穿破，他們的腳也沒有腫痛。

words.note: A set phrase meaning 'not at all lacking'.

verses.text: 你把列國和萬民賜給他們，你把列國分給他們作疆界，他們就獲得西宏之地，希實本王之地和巴珊王噩之地。

words.note: Archaic equivalent of modern 'de'.

verses.text: 你使他們的子孫眾多，像天上的星星那麼多；你把他們帶進你應許他們的列祖要進去得為業的那地。

words.note: A slightly archaic verb phrase, meaning 'to get something as'.
Often refers to inherited property or land in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 於是他們的子孫進去，獲得那地；你使那地的迦南居民向他們屈服，又把迦南眾王和那地的各民族，都交在以色列人手裡，以色列人可以隨意對待他們。

words.note: Refers to the people/inhabitants of Canaan.
Here referring to the kings of Canaan.

verses.text: 他們奪取了堅固的城、肥沃的土地，獲得了滿載各樣財寶的房屋、挖好的水井、葡萄園、橄欖園和很多果樹；他們吃得飽足，身體發胖，因你的大恩生活安逸快樂。

words.note: Verb-complement construction describing the state of being well-dug.
A verb-complement construction meaning 'to eat to satisfaction'.

verses.text: 「可是他們竟悖逆，背叛你，把你的律法丟在背後，殺害那些控告他們，要他們歸向你的先知，犯了褻瀆的大罪。

words.note: Describes actions against divine authority.
Used to bring the object before the verb.
Refers to God's law, like the Torah.
Lit. 'throw at/in'.
Figuratively means to disregard.
Often implies spiritual turning or repentance.
Lit. 'one who knows first'.
Refers to irreverence towards sacred things.

verses.text: 所以你把他們交在敵人的手中，好讓他們受困苦；他們受困苦的時候，就向你呼求，你就從天上垂聽，按著你豐盛的憐憫，賜給他們拯救者，拯救他們脫離敵人的手。

words.note: Used to bring the object before the verb.
Figuratively means under their power.
Used to form a temporal clause 'when...'
Often implies calling upon God.
Implies a higher being bending down to listen.
Often describes God's grace or blessings.
Formal term, often for gifts from a superior.
Figuratively means power or control.

verses.text: 但他們得享安寧以後，又在你面前行惡，你就撇棄他們在仇敵的手中，讓仇敵管轄他們；然而他們回轉過來，向你哀求，你就從天上垂聽，按著豐盛的憐憫，一次又一次拯救他們。

words.note: More formal than just 享受 (xiǎngshòu).
Figuratively means 'in the presence of'.
Often refers to God abandoning His people due to sin.
Figuratively means under their power.
Implies a sphere of authority.
Often used for repentance or returning to God.
Implies earnest, mournful supplication.
Implies a higher being bending down to listen.
Often describes God's grace or blessings.

verses.text: 你警告他們，要他們轉向你的律法；但他們狂妄自大，不聽從你的誡命，犯罪干犯你的典章。人應遵行這些典章，按照它們生活，他們卻固執地扭轉肩頭，硬著頸項，不肯聽從。

words.note: Often implies a spiritual turning or repentance.
Refers to God's law, like the Torah.
Implies acting against a law or person.
Figurative for refusing to bear a burden/responsibility.
Figurative for stubbornness (stiff-necked).

verses.text: 你多年容忍他們，你的靈藉著你的眾先知勸戒他們，他們還是不側耳而聽，所以你把他們交在各地的民族手中。

words.note: Here refers to God's Holy Spirit.
Used to pluralize/emphasize 'many'.
Lit. 'one who knows first'.
Figurative: 'to incline one's ear' implies paying attention.
Used to bring the object before the verb.
Figuratively means under their power.

verses.text: 然而因你豐富的憐憫，你不把他們滅盡，也不撇棄他們，因為你是有恩典有憐憫的 神。

words.note: Indicates the following noun is the object of the verb.
Elevated character often indicates a sacred name.

verses.text: 「我們的 神啊，你是至大、全能、至可畏、守約施慈愛的 神，現在求你不要把我們、我們的君王和領袖、我們的祭司和先知、我們的列祖和你的眾民，從亞述列王的日子直到今日所遭遇的一切苦難，看為小事。

words.note: Elevated character often indicates a sacred name.
慈愛 (cí'ài) means steadfast love/mercy.
Elevated character often indicates a sacred name.
Indicates the following noun is the object of the verb.

verses.text: 在一切臨到我們身上的事上，你都是公義的；因為你所行的是信實的，我們所行的是邪惡的。

words.note: Used with 在...上 to mean 'in terms of' or 'in the matter of'.

verses.text: 我們的君王和領袖，我們的祭司和列祖，都沒有遵行你的律法，也沒有留心聽從你的誡命和你向他們鄭重的警告。
他們在本國中，享受你賜給他們的大福，在你擺在他們面前這廣大肥沃的地上，卻不事奉你，不轉離他們的惡行。

words.note: Used as a locative suffix.

words.definition: place before, put in front of

verses.text: 我們今天竟成了奴僕！就是在你賜給我們列祖享用其上果實和美物之地，我們竟在這地上作了奴僕！

words.note: Common in biblical contexts for bondservant.
A formal term for giving from a superior to an inferior.
A literary or classical pronoun.
Here functions as a locative suffix.
Classical particle, similar to modern '的'.
Here functions as a locative suffix.
Common in biblical contexts for bondservant.

verses.text: 這地豐富的出產都歸給列王，就是你因我們的罪派來管轄我們的；他們也隨意管轄我們的身體和我們的牲畜；我們遭遇大患難。

words.note: Refers to moral/religious transgression.
Often used to indicate purpose, 'come to'.
Often used in religious contexts for trials or distress.

verses.text: 現在由於這一切事，我們立下確實的約，寫在文件上；我們的領袖、利未人和祭司，都在上面蓋了印。」

words.note: Refers to a solemn agreement, especially a biblical covenant.
Here functions as a locative suffix.

verses.heading: The People Pledge to be Faithful
